ETHG ensures anonymity of digital assets through ring signature technology. Each transaction has a unique key image to prevent double spending. Leveraging W3C's Distributed Identifiers (DID) and Verifiable Credentials specifications, ETHG establishes a distributed digital identity framework, enabling effective operation of verifiable credential circulation models. 🔄💼

ETHG features a built-in smart contract module package, bridging external service modules (like RPC) and underlying infrastructure modules (such as network, storage, and account modules). Other modules like storage, basic encryption algorithms, and network provide foundational support to smart contracts. Smart contracts are defined by upper-layer applications, interpreted by interpreters, stored by storage modules, and executed by the ETHG smart contract module package. The ETHG smart contract interpreter supports multiple high-level programming languages, allowing developers to design smart contracts using their preferred language. 💡💻

In addition to supporting Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) and Smart Contracts, ETHG also embraces the latest Layer2 technology. Layer2 builds upon Layer1 to provide richer functionality, aiming to solve the 'Blockchain Trilemma' and enhance network speed, efficiency, and scalability while maintaining security and decentralization. #ETHG #Layer2 #BlockchainInnovation #Web3
